intro: Hartmannia rosea var. parvifolia, commonly known as the pink wax plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, tubular pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial species, often found in humid, shaded environments. It produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded gardens.
